p:
The sudden onset of the WAM in MR and HR indicates an enhanced influence of another climate component on the principally radiatively driven WAM evolution. Caniaux et al.
21 show with an area-based ACT index (hereafter ACT area) a significant correlation between the interannual variability of the onset dates of the ACT area and the WAM for the period 1982–2007. For this they defined the ACT area onset as the first day of the year where the area of the equatorial Atlantic with SSTs below 25 °C exceeds 0.4 × 10 6 km 2. We also find a significant correlation of 0.66 between anomalies in the WAM onset and the ACT area onset about three weeks earlier (June 10, Fig. S 6), despite the different precipitation data and extended time period (1983–2014). This further supports the idea that the ACT dynamics exert a significant influence on the intraseasonal variability of the WAM onset.
